metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2510 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.3.2 isaffected. Safari before 10.1.1 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit"component. It allows remote attackers to conduct Universal XSS (UXSS)attacks via a crafted web site that improperly interacts with pageshowevents.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2510` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.16.3-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.16.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.16.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.16.3-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.16.3-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.16.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.16.3-1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
